intro: Diplotaxis viminea var. genuina, commonly known as the narrowleaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by slender, hairy seed pods. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features include linear leaves and a compact growth habit.
